snippet: Street vendors, erratic drivers, nonchalant traffic police officers: all contribute to a chaos in Cairo that is estimated to cost as much as $8 billion in lost productivity, delays and fuel waste.
abstract: Cairo Journal; traffic and congestion in Cairo is estimated to cost as much as $8 billion in lost productivity, delays and fuel waste annually and seems to show how, in many ways, little has changed since the nation's revolution.
lead_paragraph: Street vendors, erratic drivers, nonchalant traffic police officers: all contribute to a chaos in Cairo that is estimated to cost as much as $8 billion in lost productivity, delays and fuel waste.

headline.seo: For Egyptians, No Relief From Cairo’s Infamous Traffic
headline.main: A Dictator Is Gone, but Egypt’s Traffic and Congestion Seem Immovable
headline.print_headline: Traffic and Congestion Unmoved by Uprising
